articles.title: Order of Kim Il Sung Conferred on Distinguished Units
articles.content:
Order of Kim Il Sung Conferred on Distinguished Units
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Order of Kim Il Sung was conferred on Kim Il Sung Stadium, Myohyangsan History Museum and Tonghungsan Unha Garment Factory for exalting the international prestige of the country and contributing to the building of a highly civilized socialist nation and the improvement of the standard of people's living in the run-up to the Day of the Sun.
					 A relevant decree was promulgated by the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly on March 22.

articles.title: Order of Kim Il Sung Conferred on Distinguished Persons
articles.content:
Order of Kim Il Sung Conferred on Distinguished Persons
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Order of Kim Il Sung was conferred on Kim Yong Nam, Ri Su Won and Kim Kwang, who distinguished themselves in glorifying the leadership exploits of the Workers' Party of Korea and contributed to building a socialist power, in the run-up to the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 A relevant decree was promulgated by the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK on April 6.

articles.title: Spokesman of KPA General Staff Blasts U.S. Double Standards
articles.content:
Spokesman of KPA General Staff Blasts U.S. Double Standards
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army (KPA) answered the question put by KCNA on April 10 as regards the fact that the U.S. is pulling up the KPA over its measures for self-defence while shamelessly conniving at the provocative actions of its stooges.
					 Noting that the U.S., accustomed to groundlessly taking issue with the DPRK, went reckless in its anti-DPRK campaign even in the UN arena with riff-raffs involved, describing each military drill of the KPA as a "serious provocation" and "threat", the spokesman said:
					
					 This reckless action of the U.S. hell-bent on the hostile policy toward the DPRK is not something new and surprising.
					
					 However, the double-dealing approach taken by the U.S. towards the provocative actions of its stooges against the DPRK can never be overlooked.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces are now claiming that "they could strike the whole of the north" and that "they would deploy ballistic missile Hyonmu-2 with the firing range of 800km for an actual battle within this year" but the U.S. keeps mum about it as we expected.
					
					 This is a brazen-faced stance quite different from its reaction to the routine rocket firing exercise of the KPA.
					
					 Crystal clear is the reason why the U.S. is resorting to such mean gimmick. The U.S. seeks to stifle the DPRK by force at any cost, even discarding any decency and impartiality.
					
					 It shows the true colors of the U.S. styling itself the world's "judge".
					
					 Emboldened by their master's unfair double standards and double-dealing attitude of making profound confusion of right and wrong, the south Korean puppet warmongers and the Japanese reactionaries, are now going reckless, not afraid of any punishment from the Heaven.
					
					 The U.S. should ponder over the serious consequences to be entailed by its self-righteous and unilateral actions against the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean warmongers and the Japanese reactionaries had better stop behaving foolishly.
					
					 The brigandish double standards of the U.S. can never be pardoned.

articles.title: U.S. Deployment of Nuclear Carrier Task Group in Waters off Korean Peninsula under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Deployment of Nuclear Carrier Task Group in Waters off Korean Peninsula under Fire
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Ministry of Foreign Affairs gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA on Monday over the fact that the U.S. deployed a nuclear carrier task group in waters off the Korean peninsula:
					 It was disclosed that the U.S. dispatched Carl Vinson nuclear carrier task group to waters off the peninsula all of a sudden.
					
					 This goes to prove that the U.S. reckless moves for invading the DPRK have reached a serious phase of its scenario.
					
					 If the U.S. dares opt for a military action, crying out for "preemptive attack" and "removal of the headquarters", the DPRK is ready to react to any mode of war desired by the U.S.
					
					 The prevailing grave situation proves once again that the DPRK was entirely just when it increased in every way its military capabilities for self-defence and preemptive attack with a nuclear force as a pivot.
					
					 The Trump administration is foolish enough to deploy one strategic striking means after another in south Korea, trumpeting about "peace by force of arms", but the DPRK remains unfazed.
					
					 We never beg for peace but we will take the toughest counteraction against the provocateurs in order to defend ourselves by powerful force of arms and keep to the road chosen by ourselves.
					
					 We will hold the U.S. wholly accountable for the catastrophic consequences to be entailed by its outrageous actions.

articles.title: Tablet to Honor Former Russian Ambassador Unveiled at Embassy in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Tablet to Honor Former Russian Ambassador Unveiled at Embassy in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- A tablet to honor Andrei Karlov, former ambassador of the Russian Federation, was unveiled with due ceremony at the Russian embassy here on Monday.
					 Present there were Sin Hong Chol, vice-foreign minister of the DPRK, officials concerned, envoys and military attaches of foreign embassies, representatives of international bodies, Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials, widow of Andrei Karlov and her party.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony. The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of Andrei Karlov.
					
					 Then the table was unveiled. Written on it having the image of Karlov and Hero Medal in bold relief is the sentence that he, a Russian hero and diplomat, worked in the DPRK for his country.
					
					 The participants laid bouquets at the tablet.

articles.title: Official of Norwegian Communist Party Arrives
articles.content:
Official of Norwegian Communist Party Arrives
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, arrived here on Monday to celebrate the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Here
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Here
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Family members of Zhang Weihua, a Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, and those of Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Bao-zhong, a Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, arrived here Monday to mark the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Foreigners Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners and Overseas Koreans Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Foreigners and Overseas Koreans visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Monday.
					 They included family members of Zhang Weihua, a Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, family members of Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Bao-zhong, a Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, and the delegations of the International United Confederation of Koreans, the United Confederation of Koreans in the Far Eastern Region of Russia, the United Confederation of Koreans in Kamchatka Territory of Russia, and Korean residents in Ussuriysk of Russia.
					
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the statues and paid tribute to the great leaders.

articles.title: Overseas Compatriots' Delegations Here
articles.content:
Overseas Compatriots' Delegations Here
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Delegations of overseas compatriots came here Monday to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They are a delegation of the International United Confederation of Koreans led by First Vice-Chairman Kim Chil Song, a delegation of the United Confederation of Koreans in Far Eastern Region of Russia led by Chairman Ri Ku Yul, a delegation of the United Confederation of Koreans in Kamchatka Territory of Russia led by Ju Pun Yong, and a delegation of compatriots in Ussuriysk of Russia led by Kim Kyong Ryol, vice-chairman of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia.
					
					 Arriving earlier was Kwak Yun Chang, a delegate of the Federation of Koreans in Australia.

articles.title: Foreign Marathoners Leave
articles.content:
Foreign Marathoners Leave
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Marathoners from Rwanda, Morocco, Kenya, Ethiopia and Ukraine left Monday after taking part in the 28th Mangyongdae Prize International Marathon held to mark the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: SPA Deputies Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
SPA Deputies Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The deputies to take part in the 5th Session of the 13th Supreme People's Assembly visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Monday.
					 Among them were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and other senior party, state and army officials.
					
					 They laid a floral basket and bouquets and made bows to the statues.

articles.title: Deputies to SPA Tour Several Places in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Deputies to SPA Tour Several Places in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Deputies to the 5th session of the 13th Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) visited the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt Taesong Monday.
					 They laid bouquets before the bust of anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk and observed a moment's silence in her memory. 
					
					 Then they looked round the cemetery.
					
					 They also visited the Pyongyang Bag Factory and the Pyongyang Primary School for Orphans on the same day.

articles.title: Ceremony of Service Personnel of KPA Marks Day of Sun
articles.content:
Ceremony of Service Personnel of KPA Marks Day of Sun
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Service personnel of the Army, Navy, Air and Anti-Air Force of the Korean People's Army (KPA) held a ceremony at the plaza of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Monday to pay high tribute to Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and vow to remain loyal to respected Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 Present there were KPA Vice Marshal Hwang Pyong So, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, KPA Vice Marshal Ri Myong Su, chief of the General Staff of the KPA, Army General Pak Yong Sik, minister of the People's Armed Forces, and other commanding officers of the KPA.
					
					 There took place a ceremony of the Military Band of the KPA. 
					
					 All the participants paid high tribute to the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A twenty-one-gun salute was fired.
					
					 Hwang Pyong So made a speech paying high tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and vowing to remain loyal to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The speaker said Kim Il Sung founded and successfully embodied the immortal Juche idea and Songun idea, worked such a miracle as defeating the most ferocious U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation and built a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence on this land.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, hewing out the thorny path of the Songun revolution, won a series of victories in the struggle for defending socialism and in the confrontation with the U.S. and laid an eternal foundation for the prosperity of the posterity by dedicating himself to the country, the speaker said.
					
					 He made a pledge of the faith and will of all the service personnel to hold Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal leaders of the party and the people and bring earlier the day of the final victory under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 There was a march-past of the officers and men of the Army, Navy and Air and Anti-Air Force of the KPA and cadets of the military academies at all levels and students of revolutionary schools at the plaza.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Lao President
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Lao President
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from Bounnhang Vorachith, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic, on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The floral basket was conveyed to an official concerned on Monday by Phonekham Inthaboualy, Lao ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: National Photo Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
National Photo Exhibition Opens
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- A national photo exhibition for celebrating the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was opened with due ceremony at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday.
					 On display there is a photo of Kim Il Sung standing with a broad smile on his face.
					
					 At the exhibition there are photos showing the revolutionary career of the President who had performed immortal feats for the country and its people, the era and history with his distinguished idea and leadership and noble virtue.
					
					 Among them are photos helping visitors recall the revolutionary activities of the President and leader Kim Jong Il who had always worked together for the happiness of the people.
					
					 They also include photos dealing with the traits of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un who is making a history of people-first principle on this land by embodying the great leaders' idea of believing in the people as in Heaven.
					
					 Also, displayed are photos showing the reality of the DPRK and the revolutionary stamina of its army and people.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, vice-chairman of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and citizens.

articles.title: 5th April Spring People's Art Festival Opens
articles.content:
5th April Spring People's Art Festival Opens
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The 5th April Spring People's Art Festival was opened with due ceremony at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Monday in celebration of the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The art festival brought together more than 1,500 artistes and working people of over 40 organizations selected in the capital and local areas. It is divided into categories of art troupes, art squads, itinerant art squads and art groups with a magic festival to be included.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, vice-chairman of the WPK Central Committee, and Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, officials concerned, participants in the art festival and working people in the city.
					
					 Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture, said in his inaugural speech that the art festival is a great political art festival of Juche Korea where the participants will represent through dances and songs the people's intense loyalty to the great leaders, their oath of unshakable faith to respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un and their conviction and optimism in the final victory of the revolution.
					
					 He expressed the belief that the festival would instill the revolutionary enthusiasm into the Korean people and rev up the atmosphere celebrating the Day of the Sun.
					
					 Then followed an opening performance.

articles.title: Film Week Opens to Mark Day of Sun
articles.content:
Film Week Opens to Mark Day of Sun
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- A film week opened in the DPRK to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 To be screened during the film week at cinemas and cultural houses in Pyongyang and provinces are documentaries such as "The President to Be Remembered by Humankind Forever", "Eternal Sun of Humankind" and "Always Remembering the Leader" dealing with the revolutionary career of the President.
					
					 Feature films like "Star of Korea", "Sun of Nation", "Great Embrace", etc. will also be shown.
					
					 An opening ceremony held at the People's Palace of Culture Monday was attended by officials concerned, creators and artistes in the field of film art and working people in the city.
					
					 Minister of Culture Pak Chun Nam in his opening address said the film week would help all the party members and other people grasp more deeply the undying exploits performed by the President and leader Kim Jong Il for the times and the revolution, the country and its people and their noble personalities.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants watched documentary "Our Leader Praised by All People".
					
					 The film week also opened in provinces on the same day.

articles.title: 32nd National Sci-Tech Festival Closes
articles.content:
32nd National Sci-Tech Festival Closes
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The 32nd national sci-tech festival came to a close.
					 Presented to it were more than 560 scientific research and technological innovation achievements.
					
					 Special prizes went to IT College of Kim Il Sung University which established a comprehensive information system in the film editing process, the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex which established the fourth generation catalyst production process and four other units.
					
					 The first place in the festival was taken by more than 60 units including Kim Chaek University of Technology and Pyongyang Kim Jong Suk Silk Mill.
					
					 The closing ceremony took place at the Sci-Tech Complex Monday. Present there were Choe Thae Bok, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea, officials concerned, scientists, technicians, workers, peasants, three-revolution team members, teachers, researchers, students and post-graduate students.

articles.title: Workers' Art Group Gives Performance
articles.content:
Workers' Art Group Gives Performance
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by the Workers' Art Group of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea at the Central Hall of Workers on Monday to celebrate the 5th anniversary of holding respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un in high esteem at the top posts of the party and the state.
					 Its numbers included chorus "Glory to General Kim Jong Un", poem and story-telling "The Great Sun of Love and Kayagum and male vocal quintet "Our Nation Is Best".
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the reverence of the Korean army and people for the respected Supreme Leader.
					
					 They represented the oath of the working class to repay the loving care and trust shown by Kim Jong Un with loyalty.

articles.title: Korean Stamp Exhibitions Open
articles.content:
Korean Stamp Exhibitions Open
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Korean stamp exhibitions were opened at the Korean Stamps Museum and the Korean Stamp Exhibition House on Monday to celebrate the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On display at the venues of the exhibitions are photos dealing with stamps that carry portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Stamps of hundreds of kinds, displayed under the titles "Eternal smile of the sun" and "History of the sun", help the participants recollect the career of the President.
					
					 At the exhibitions there are stamps of different themes presented by philatelists in the city of Pyongyang.
					
					 The exhibitions will remain open till April 20.

articles.title: Association of Korean Children in Jilin
articles.content:
Association of Korean Children in Jilin
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- It has been 90 years since the formation of the Association of Korean Children in Jilin.
					 After embarking upon the road of revolution in his teens, President Kim Il Sung formed the Saenal Children's Union in Fusong, China and moved to Jilin, China for vigorous revolutionary activities.
					
					 At that time, students in Jilin remained passive in keeping the class and anti-imperialist stand and failed to take root deeper among the masses. After acquainting himself in detail with the situation, he formed the Association of Korean Children in Jilin, a legal organization, on April 10 1927.
					
					 The aim of the Association of Korean Children in Jilin was to educate children in the anti-Japanese idea and bring them up to be reliable reserves for the revolution.
					
					 The feats and experience of the Association of Korean Children in Jilin served as important asset for the movement of the Korean children.
					
					 Under the guidance of the President, the association pushed ahead with the work to educate children in the anti-Japanese idea and physically prepare them.
					
					 In this process, revolutionary forces of new generation had rapidly increased and later, they were embraced in the Anti-Imperialist Youth League (August 27, 1927) and the Young Communist League of Korea (August 28, 1927) to grow into revolutionaries.
					
					 The glorious revolutionary tradition of the Korean children's movement provided in the flames of the anti-Japanese struggle has been reliably carried forward by the Korean Children's Union (KCU) after Korea's liberation from Japan's colonial rule and becomes evermore brilliant under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Today the KCU members are brought up to be reliable pillars of prosperous Korea under the slogan "Always Ready for the Socialist Motherland!"

articles.title: Achievements Made in Putting Forest Science on IT Basis
articles.content:
Achievements Made in Putting Forest Science on IT Basis
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Many achievements have been made in putting the forest science on an IT basis in the DPRK.
					 Information service program for managing forest resources was developed to ensure promptness and correctness in survey of resources with the help of database comprehensively storing the information on forest resources of the country and digital map containing satellite images.
					
					 And forest-fire information service system has been introduced in various units to prove effective.
					
					 Achievements have also been made in updating the homepage "Hwanggumsan (Golden Mountain)" for disseminating forest science and technology. The homepage provides readers with new detailed data on forestation and protection of forest like methods of sapling production and sapling cultivation at nurseries.

articles.title: U.S. Colonial Rule over South Korea Is Bound to Collapse: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Colonial Rule over South Korea Is Bound to Collapse: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The U.S. which has closely followed the chaotic political climate in south Korea is working hard to maintain its colonial rule by running the whole gamut of tricks, displeased with the ever-increasing possibility of collapse of the conservative regime and regime change by the progressive pro-reform forces in south Korea, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The reality goes to clearly prove that the U.S. remains unchanged in its wild ambition for maintaining its colonial rule over south Korea and gets ever more sly and vicious in its methods to quench the south Korean people's growing desire for independence.
					
					 Whenever south Korea faced a serious political crisis and the popular struggle for achieving democracy grew strong, the U.S. maintained its colonial rule by replacing its lackeys with others and setting up a new puppet regime.
					
					 The U.S. works hard to maintain its colonial rule over south Korea in a bid to attain its interests for aggression.
					
					 There exists the "National Assembly" and "government" in south Korea but they are no more than camouflage to cover up the aggressive and exploitative colonial domination system of the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. has occupied south Korea for over 70 years, mercilessly trampling down the aspiration and demand of the south Korean people for independence, democracy and reunification and buckling down to preserving its colonial rule over it. This impudent act should never be pardoned.
					
					 The colonial rule that divided the territory of Korea and the homogeneous Korean nation into two and inflicted unbearable pain upon the Koreans is bound to collapse by the united struggle of Koreans in the north, the south and abroad.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Hwang Kyo An's Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Hwang Kyo An's Reckless Remarks
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- At a recent memorial service for the victims of the April 3 Popular Uprising on Jeju Island, traitor Hwang Kyo An, acting president of south Korea, groundlessly pulled up the DPRK over what he called "reckless provocation" and the like. He talked nonsense that social conflict and state of division are serious in south Korea owing to it.  At the "state council meeting" next day, he cried out for "necessary strong counteraction," talking about the "possibility of strategic provocation from the north." 
					 Commenting on his deed, Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary says it is disgusting that Hwang is so busy inciting confrontation with the compatriots in the north, regardless of time and circumstances.
					
					 What the traitor uttered is an unpardonable insult to the resistance fighters on Jeju Island who unhesitatingly dedicated themselves to independence and reunification, the commentary says, and goes on: 
					
					 A flurry of invective let out by Hwang, while pretending to be ignorant of the reckless military provocations being perpetrated by the south Korean regime together with outside forces, is no more than a cynical ploy to justify the policy of war and confrontation sternly judged by history and persistently pursue it.
					
					 It is shame on the nation that such heinous traitors are allowed to be at large to persist in doing harm to compatriots while kowtowing to outside forces.
					
					 Hwang will have to pay the highest price for working so hard to persistently carry forward Park Geun Hye's policy of confrontation.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Increasing Dependence on Outside Forces under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Increasing Dependence on Outside Forces under Fire
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- No sooner had the U.S. administration made public an "executive order for sanctions on the north" than the south Korean puppet forces welcomed it with open arms, terming it "strong will for the north's denuclearization" and "resolute warning message".
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary terms the publication of the "executive order" last-ditch efforts of losers.
					
					 The puppet forces heaped praises on the sanctions racket of the American master only to arouse derision of the public at home and abroad, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 It is the inveterate bad habit of the puppet forces to do harm to the fellow countrymen by clinging to the coattail of outsiders. 
					
					 Such bad habit can never change before they go to their graves.
					
					 No sanctions will ever work on the DPRK.
					
					 It is the puppet forces themselves who were thrown into a total collapse while trying to do harm to others.
					
					 Fools can never understand how things are going on in the world.
					
					 No matter how desperately the puppet forces may resort to the moves for stifling the fellow countrymen while taking the advantages of the U.S. racket for sanctions on the DPRK, it will get it nowhere.
					
					 The above-said traitors will not be able to escape a stern punishment by history and the nation.

articles.title: Works of Kim Jong Il, Kim Jong Un Introduced in Russia
articles.content:
U.S. Deployment of Nuclear Carrier Task Group in Waters off Korean Peninsula under Fire
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Ministry of Foreign Affairs gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA on Monday over the fact that the U.S. deployed a nuclear carrier task group in waters off the Korean peninsula:
					 It was disclosed that the U.S. dispatched Carl Vinson nuclear carrier task group to waters off the peninsula all of a sudden.

articles.title: Seminars on Kim Il Sung's Exploits Held in Different Countries
articles.content:
Seminars on Kim Il Sung's Exploits Held in Different Countries
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Seminars on President Kim Il Sung's exploits were held in DR Congo, Ethiopia, Pakistan and Nepal on Mar. 17-25, ahead of the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung.
					 On display at their venues were photos showing the revolutionary careers and exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the revolutionary activities of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 There were also their works and books and pictures introducing the Korean army and people in their struggle to usher in a golden age in building a socialist power.
					
					 Boswa Isekombe Sylvere, general secretary of the Communist Party of DR Congo and chairman of the preparatory committee of DR Congo for celebrating the Day of the Sun, praised Kim Il Sung as a distinguished thinker-theoretician, invincible and iron-willed commander, peerlessly great man and father of all people.
					
					 Andre Lohekele Kalonda, chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo, said that the President is the greatest man who devoted his all to the people's happiness, the country's prosperity and the cause of global independence, adding his exploits will be always kept in the hearts of the Korean people and the world progressives.
					
					 Nigatu Dagnachew Cherinet, chairman of the Ethiopian preparatory committee for celebrating the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, said that the President is a prominent leader as he defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation, built a genuine people's country in Korea and made titanic contributions to the cause of global independence.
					
					 Berkat Ullah, chairman of the Pakistani Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea, and others recalled that the President achieved the historic cause of national liberation, turned the DPRK into a socialist country independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence and dynamically advanced the cause of independence against imperialism.

articles.title: DPRK Book, Photo and Art Exhibition Opens in China
articles.content:
DPRK Book, Photo and Art Exhibition Opens in China
Beijing, April 9 (KCNA Correspondent) -- A DPRK book, photo and art exhibition was opened in Beijing of China on April 9 to celebrate the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Displayed at its venue were photos showing the careers and feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the revolutionary activities of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 And there were works of the brilliant great persons of Mt Paektu, books, photos and stamps introducing the reality of the DPRK, the five thousand year-long history of Korea and its culture and art works associated with creative talents of the Korean people.
					
					 The participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Speeches were made at its opening ceremony.
					
					 The director of the Korean Overseas Exhibition General Bureau said that Kim Il Sung who made great contribution to the Korean revolution and the cause of global independence is the father of socialist Korea and the eternal sun of Juche.
					
					 He expressed expectation that the exhibition would offer a good occasion in strengthening various cultural exchange and cooperation between the two peoples.
					
					 The chairman of the Sino-DPRK Stamp Society and other figures noted that Kim Il Sung who liberated the country and built a powerful socialist sate is the great leader of the Korean people.
					
					 They referred to the reality of the DPRK greeting a new era of prosperity in building a socialist power under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The participants watched a Korean documentary film "Prosperous Pyongyang".
					
					 The exhibition will last until April 15.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones de Presidente sirio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones de Presidente sirio
Pyongyang, 10 de abril (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la RPDC, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion enviado el dia 9 por Bashar al-Assad, Presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria.
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					En ocasion del V aniversario de su eleccion como Maximo Dirigente del PTC y la RPDC, le extiendo la sincera felicitacion a Vd., y le deseo mayores exitos a Vd.
					
					Su eleccion a los cargos supremos del PTC y la RPDC es la expresion de confianza de la direccion y el pueblo de Corea y sirve del motivo para consolidar mas la linea de la revolucion coreana de realizar en la etapa mas elevada las metas de lucha del partido y la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo y la causa de independencia del mundo, fundamentada en base preparada por el eterno Presidente Kim Il Sung y continuada por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, eterno lider del PTC.
					
					Dirijo una vez mas las felicitaciones a Vd., quien goza de gran confianza del partido y el pueblo, y le formulo votos a Ud. por la buena salud y felicidad y el progreso y la prosperidad al vuestro pueblo amistoso guiado por la sabia orientacion de Vd.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de Presidente sirio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de Presidente sirio
Pyongyang, 10 de abril (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le remitiera el dia 9 Bashar al-Assad, Presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria.
					La misiva senala como sigue: 
					
					En ocasion del 15 de abril, Dia del Sol, cuando se cumple el 105o aniversario de natalicio de Su Excelencia eterno Presidente Kim Il Sung, le extiendo la sincera y calurosa felicitacion a Vd. y al amistoso pueblo coreano en nombre del pueblo arabe sirio y en el mio propio. 
					
					Nuestros dos paises amistosos conmemoran esta oportunidad, y, al mismo tiempo, libran una guerra frente a la codicia de las potencias tendentes a someter todos los paises del mundo a su politica expansionista y dominacionista y arrebatar el derecho a la autodeterminacion de esos paises. 
					
					Tanto ayer como hoy, los pueblos de nuestros dos paises luchan por el derecho a la autodeterminacion, la soberania nacional, la seguridad y prosperidad del pais. 
					
					Aprovecho esta oportunidad importante para expresar mi conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre nuestros dos paises se intensificaran mas de acuerdo con los intereses de los pueblos de dos paises.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe cesto de flores enviado por el Presidente laosiano
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe cesto de flores enviado por el Presidente laosiano
Pyongyang, 10 de abril (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un recibio un cesto de flores que con motivo del Dia del Sol, le enviara el Presidente de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao, Bounnhang Vorachith, quien es Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao. 
					El embajador laosiano en Corea, Phonekham Inthaboualy, lo entrego el dia 10 a un funcionario coreano.

articles.title: El vocero del MINREX condena a EE.UU. que envia portaaviones nuclear en las cercanias de Peninsula Coreana
articles.content:
El vocero del MINREX condena a EE.UU. que envia portaaviones nuclear en las cercanias de Peninsula Coreana
Pyongyang, 10 de abril (ACNC) -- A la pregunta de un reportero de la ACNC formulada con respecto a que EE.UU. emplaza en la zona maritima de la Peninsula Coreana el colectivo de golpe de portaaviones nuclear, el vocero del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio el dia 10 la siguiente respuesta:
					Fue aclarado el hecho de que EE.UU. despacho urgentemente a aguas de la Peninsula Coreana la flotilla de ataque de portaaviones nuclear Carl Vinson. 
					
					Esta nueva accion militar muestra que entraron en la etapa practica las imprudentes maquinaciones agresivas de EE.UU. contra la RPDC.
					
					Si el pais norteamericano quiere tomar la opcion militar hablando atrevidamente de la "ataque preventivo" y la "eliminacion de la Direccion", la RPDC respondera con gusto a cualesquier manera que desee EE.UU. 
					
					La rigurosa situacion de hoy vuelve a mostrar la justeza de las medidas de la RPDC que ha venido consolidando por todos los medios la capacidad de autodefensa nacional centrada en las fuerzas armadas nucleares y la habilidad de dar el primer ataque.
					
					Si bien la administracion de Trump envia uno tras otro los medios estrategicos de golpe en la region de la Peninsula Coreana hablando tanto de la "paz basada en fuerza" para atentar a la RPDC que se queda absolutamente indiferente. 
					
					La RPDC no mendiga jamas la paz, sino defendera con gran fuerza a si misma y marchara por su camino haciendo frente con intransigencia a los provocadores.
					
					La RPDC hara que EE.UU. se responsabilice totalmente de las consecuencias catastroficas que se produciran por su brutal comportamiento.
